intro: Eschweilera garagarae, commonly known as the Guianan wax palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Guyana and northern Brazil. This palm is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible fruits that are dispersed by birds. Due to habitat loss, Eschweilera garagarae is considered vulnerable and is of interest for conservation efforts.
